WRITING.TEXT: I only play Sombra, so this might not apply to every hero since her weapon spread is so large, but I use low sensitivity combined with a very large mouse pad. I believe I use 600 DPI with a sniper button on my mouse (G502) that further lowers it to 400 if I need to track something farther away.

That's why I stopped playing competitive. I main Sombra and am actually really good with her, but I was sick of hearing everyone complaining and bitching to me every round in comp, so now I only do quickplay. Overwatch competitive has become toxic just like CS:GO or LoL and it ruined the fun. Bottom line is that I play to have fun, and that's all that matters to me. Other people might have different opinions, and that's fine. I'll stick to quickplay and they can play competitive.

Oh yeah definitely. One of my favorite tactics is hacking a health pack and making my enemies chase me to it. (Or putting a translocator on it) I can then just sit on it and wreck their shit.
Another thing about Sombra, is I often play with a friend who is a Mercy main, so he gives me damage boost and heals me when I need it. The damage boost really helps Sombra. It turns her into a mini Bastion (well not quite, but you get the point). It's great.

My Jeep actually, for completely different reasons than most people are listing here. It's very hard to explain, but driving a pre-Chrysler designed Jeep is very different from driving any other car. It's surprisingly "springy" when you press the accelerator, yet is one of the slowest vehicles I have ever driven (0-60 of maybe) Having all around leaf springs gives ride quality somewhere between shit and rubbish on the road, the steering has almost no feedback (AMC and early Chrysler Jeeps have way too much power in their power steering), not to me tion it's pretty sensitive, and the transmission feels like driving a truck. The body roll is horrendous, and anything over 70 makes it feel like the Jeep is about to shake itself apart, since none of the door fit correctly and the top isn't sealed with the windshield. This is in a unmodified 1995 YJ, mind you with pretty low miles and made up of parts from about 5 different jeeps. . This is how they drove stock too and I absolutely love it. It's absurdly fun and horribly dangerous (no airbags, no abs, no crumple zones, high chance of rollover, etc) , but that's what makes it great.
TL;DR: sorry for the clique, but It's a Jeep thing. Driving a death trap has its benefits.

Your translocator is your best friend. Stick it right on top of a hacked health pack and wreck the enemy team from behind. As soon as you take significant damage, teleport back to the health pack. Rinse and repeat, while hacking as many enemies and health packs as possible. You also want to turn your mouse sensitivity wayyy down. It helps combat the absurd SMG spread and helps you keep on target. Since you also can see enemies that are critically injured, always go after them first. If you get into a 1v1 situation, turn it into a running battle so you can either escape or slowly wear down your opponent and kill them. Avoid Symettra/Zarya/Winston at all costs since they dont really have to aim and you can't escape once you start taking damage.You can also take damage while translocating at both the starting position and at the translocator for a short period of time while the animation is playing (which is really unfair, and why you can't escape Symettras beam) Doing all this, I can usually get gold or silver in eliminations, albeit in quickplay. I don't play comp though because I'm sick of getting screamed at for maining Sombra.
too much Overwatch
That's why I main her. She's fun as hell to play as. Fucking with the enemy team is great.

It is a libertarian subgroup. Libertarianism isn't one set group. The term libertarian describes a pretty wide range of ideologies, from Anarcho-capitalists to Libertarian Socialists. Most libertarians fall somewhere in the middle, though lean towards the Minarchist/AnCap side (mind you, most libertarians still believe in a state, just a minimal one).

I've actually found that ads with one photo and very little to no information actually tend to work out pretty well if the car is cheap. They are usually cars that have just been sitting in someone's driveway that they never use. I bought a 1985 Ford Ranger XLT 4x4 that way for $800 and it was flawless other than being a little dusty (and being an auto, but I needed a car at the time and love first gen Rangers). I eventually blew the head gasket and killed the engine, but that thing was great. It had no rust either, which was rare for being in Ohio.

I think that's a little unfair to the developers. They've been doing a phenomenal job with updates. They have to finish the base game first before they go out and start fixing every little bug or problem, hence why the game is still in Alpha. This game is still one of the best, if not best alpha/pre-alpha games out there right now. Bugs are going to be there, especially if you are playing experimental.
Awesome, thanks. The warning were just freaking me out and I didn't want to have my Seamoth explode within my Cyclops.

I'lll throw my build in since it seems to be the weakest listed so far and I consistently get 144fps with minor stuttering and drops to around 60.
i7 4790k
R9 290
16GB Ram
128GB SSD
I recently switched my install directory from my HDD to my SSD and it made more difference than anything. Almost no stutters or FPS drops. I get excellent performance and can run the game around 144fps consistently, which is also the refresh rate of my monitor if that makes any difference. I also deleted the corresponding batch file that is responsible for the lag when loading new areas. Mind you, this is playing on experimental as well. It seems to be a crapshoot from system to system though. I know that the Youtuber Jacksepticeye runs twin GTX Titans in SLI and gets pretty poor performance and stuttering, so it doesnt seem to really be based on the power of your system.
Switching to an SSD made a huge difference for me, it used to take a couple of minutes to load up the game after selecting the save file while I had it installed on my HDD (Western Digital Blue 7200rpm) but now it only takes a few seconds. I attribute the lack of lag when entering a new biome to my SSD as well since that ceased once I made the switch.
At this point in the game since it is early access still, its not well optimized so we should see performance increase in the future as bugs and glitches get fleshed out and taken care of. The devs have been doing an amazing job pumping out updates and I have no doubt they are capable of making the game ,more optimized once all the content is there.
All in all, this is the best early access game I have ever played and I am looking forward to the future, so thank you devs for making such a phenomenal game.
Sorry for the long wall of text and I got off topic a bit, but I think I answered your question pretty well.
**TL;DR; Get an SSD**

WRITING.TITLE: Question about vehicle depth when docked
WRITING.TEXT: If my Seamoth is docked in my Cyclops, can I still only go down to 300m? I don't want to test it to find out since I keep getting the crush warning for my Seamoth.Also curious because I was watching Jacksepticeyes play through and he undocks his Seamoth from his Cyclops whenever he goes below crush depth for the Seamoth.

Obviously an SSD is better, but if your sole purpose of buying one is to improve loading times/performance in this game, it won't make a difference. I've had Subnautica installed on both my HDD and SSD at different points TS recently and there is very little difference other than how fast the game launches and gets past the loading screen. Still, go for the SSD if you can. It's so much better in every way for he general computer tasks and may actually be of greater help once the game is more optimized.

It's not a problem with your storage device. The game isn't optimized yet, so whenever a new area needs to load, the game gets laggy and it only gets worse over time. If I recall correctly, there is a specific batch file you can delete in your Subnautica directory that should cut down the lag quite a bit. You may have to delete it every once in awhile (as in delete it again) if your game gets too laggy.

WRITING.TITLE: Removing Bedliner from yj floor pans
WRITING.TEXT: I've been using a wire brush attached to an electric drill and a chisel to remove the crappy bedliner that the previous owner of my Jeep decided to use to rust proof the floor pans but it's kinda taking forever. Do any of you know a better/quicker way of doing this? I'm trying to strip pretty much the entire interior of the body tub of paint/liner so I can have the rocker rust cut out and replaced as well have it professionally line-x'd. Any thoughts? Is there even a quicker way, or am I doomed to freeze my ass off for another 12 hours to get it done. So far all I have done is the driver side floor pan.

I dunno. I play Sombra almost exclusively lately and I find that if I can surprise hack them from behind and them charge in, I can usually take them out (with the exception of most tanks). Either that or hack them and bait them into chasing me and I can wear them down (and hack any health packs along the way) and eliminate them that way. The second way is how most of my 1v1s turn out and I think it works brilliantly, since either I win or can quickly translocate away if I'm about to lose.

Yeah. I think people just have a problem with the pretty big learning curve she has. I sucked with her at first but eventually got good enough with her that she is my main now. (My previous main was Soldier76, so it was a pretty big change) She still probably needs a reduction to her weapon spread, but she is pretty viable, at least in quickplay and low-mid level comp. (I won't speak to high level stuff since I have no experience playing at that level). In the end she is a blast to play as, and that's really all that matters to me.

WRITING.TITLE: [USA-OH][H] LG34UM95-P Ultrawide Monitor [W]Local Cash, Paypal, GTX1080
WRITING.TEXT:
Local pickup only, I will not ship. I am local to 44236.
[Timestamp](http://i.imgur.com/DECrLGK.jpg)
I got this monitor last spring and have loved it. Ultrawide really is amazing. Unfortunately my R9 290 is not up to the task of running most games on this monitor. The screen has no scratches and no light bleed to my knowledge (meaning I never noticed any), which is a common issue with this monitor.
The resolution is 3440x1440p and the refresh rate is 60hz.
I had the monitor on a desk mounted VESA mount, which is why the stand is not currently attached. I am missing the screws to reattach the stand, but other than that, the monitor is perfect.
Right now its just taking up space in my closet so I may as well sell it.
I'm asking $500 or possible trade for a GTX1080. I may be interested in other GPUs as well + cash.
Edit: Lowered the price
